title: Cannot restore backuped bookmarks
content:
Hello, after a power cut I lost all my bookmarks. When I try "Manage Bookmarks -> Import and Backup -> Restore -> Choose File..." nothing happens.

In the folder ".mozilla/firefox/6924v31j.default-1728390329118/bookmarkbackups" there are several backup files, but the newest has the date Jun 25, though the name suggests it's from Jul 2: -rw-r--r-- 23850 Jun 25 13:07 'bookmarks-2025-07-02_184_mg1znof1NbBiyJ14ZcO9SluvTvLZI-rxPSm20YZUJww=.jsonlz4'

In the directory ".mozilla/firefox/6924v31j.default-1728390329118" there is also places.sqlite from Jul 4 11:59 (that was the moment when the power was cut).

How can I restore my bookmarks?

title: Recommended Stories turns itself back on every time I open Firefox
content:
I have Firefox on 4 separate devices (Windows 10, Windows 11, Linux Ubuntu derivative x 2).

For the last 2 weeks, every time I open Firefox, the recommended stories are active. I go into settings, turn off the setting and it behaves correctly for that session. However, when I open Firefox on a different device, or the next time, recommended stories are showing once again. I like and want a clean, minimalist interface, and expect Firefox to honour my settings.

Thank you.

title: Why Trade Show Booth Rental in Las Vegas Is the Smart Choice for Exhibitors
content:
Las Vegas is one of the most popular destinations for global trade shows and expos, making it essential for brands to stand out in a competitive crowd. Choosing a trade show booth rental in Las Vegas offers flexibility, cost-efficiency, and the opportunity to impress attendees without the hassle of ownership.

A Las Vegas booth rental allows companies to select from a variety of pre-engineered or custom solutions tailored to their branding needs. Whether you want something simple or eye-catching, rental options provide room for creativity without blowing your budget.

Many exhibit companies in Las Vegas offer turnkey services—handling design, logistics, installation, and dismantling—allowing you to focus on networking and business growth. These local experts understand the nuances of major venues like the Las Vegas Convention Center, helping ensure compliance and optimal booth performance.

Working with experienced trade show booth builders also means your brand will benefit from fast, efficient setup and a professional finish that draws attention. In a city known for its sparkle and energy, your booth should shine too.

Opting for a booth rental in Las Vegas is not just about convenience—it’s a strategic move to elevate your trade show ROI.

title: Problem with desktop icon logos
content:
HI Mozilla, I have recently purchased a new laptop and am setting up my desktop icons. I have the latest version of Firefox on both the old one and this one. also Windows 11

On the old computer (which I set up 18 months ago and still works) the desktop icons show the website logo. The correct logo appears for any newly opened websites for which I set a desktop icon.

On this computer all website desktop icons show the Firefox logo and not the website logo. This happens whether I drag the address or the lock symbol. I can change the icon using the inbuilt menu, but this is tedious and I would prefer them be the correct ones.

The correct logo appears if I right click on an app in the start list and drag it to the desktop.

Consequently I think the above is a Firefox problem.

I have been using Firefox for some years very successfully.

Regards Peter Adam Brisbane Australia
creator: pa.pedro.adam

title: Auto-fill URL like Chrome
content:
In Chrome, for example, if you type "maps" in the address bar, it will autofill to "maps.google.com", which then redirects to the correct URL, "google.com/maps". Initially, it doesn’t do this, but if you do it repeatedly, Chrome eventually learns and sends you directly to that URL when you type "maps". The same happens with "gmail" or even just "gm", which redirect to "gmail.com" or "mail.google.com". Does Firefox have this kind of feature?

I think I browsed a reddit thread from a few years ago asking this same problem having something to do with autofill frequency which doesn't work, because the actual url is not, in the example of maps, maps.google.com and the url I want to enter redirects to it.

title: Firefox não preserva as abas e janelas entre as sessões
content:
Olá a todos. Estou a utilizar o Firefox 140.0.2 (64-bits) numa instalação recente do Arch Linux, instalado a partir do repositório oficial e, por algum motivo, as abas não são restauradas ao iniciar uma nova sessão. As configurações encontram-se ajustadas (Geral -> Iniciar -> Abrir abas e janelas anteriores), mas sem efeito. Para fins de referência, outros navegadores instalados comportam-se normalmente em relação a este aspecto. Viria a ser um erro, ou há alguma medida adicional necessária para correto funcionamento desta configuração?

Desde já, agradeço pelas considerações.
creator: rogerjgamito

title: Amazon shortcut is messed up
content:
Firefox has shortcuts at the top of any new tab opened. These are usually your most visited pages. For most shortcuts, if you click the three dots you get a menu of: Pin Edit Open in a New Window Open in a New Private Window Dismiss Delete From History

This is the menu you get for almost all shortcuts EXCEPT for Amazon. For the Amazon shortcut you get: Pin Dismiss

That's it. No opportunity to edit it. And if you click on the shortcut, it doesn't take you to Amazon.com, instead it opens "Amazon.com Search" in the address bar. I don't want Search, I want to go to the Amazon home page but the shortcut doesn't take me to the Amazon homepage like it used to. Why is this broken now?
creator: kevingthompson
